Class MenuUtil

  • public final class MenuUtil
extends java.lang.Object

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void closeInventory(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player player)
      Closing the menu 1 tick later prevents item duping.
      In order to close all other views (like books that normally don't have a close-method) a inventory-open is sent prior to closing the inventory.
      Note: This is not a API method and does not notify, it's to visually close a view on the client.
      static java.util.Set<IElement> getAllElementsAt(IMenu menu, int page, org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.property.SlotPos pos)
      Elements in a menu can overlap since the menu does not store or handle positional information other than pages.
      static java.util.Optional<IElement> getElementAt(IMenu menu, int page, org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.property.SlotPos pos)
      Performs the same lookup as getElementsAtPosition, but only returns the first result in case you know that a position does not contain more than one element at any given time.
      static java.util.Optional<org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.Inventory> getSlotByAnyMeans(org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.Inventory inventory, org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.property.SlotPos pos)
      looks like inventory properties like slot position etc are not always properly passed down to sub inventories, thus I'll make it work...
      static void openInventory(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player player, org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.Inventory inventory)
      Open the menu 1 tick later for consistency.
      Unlike closeInventory this does not open a inventory before closing, because opening a inventory always overlaps.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllElementsAt

        public static java.util.Set<IElement> getAllElementsAt(IMenu menu,
                                                       int page,
                                                       org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.property.SlotPos pos)
        Elements in a menu can overlap since the menu does not store or handle positional information other than pages. This method searches on elements on a page that occupy a specific position.#
        Parameters:
        menu - the menu to search for elements
        page - the page to search
        pos - the x and y coordinates to search for elements
        Returns:
        all elements that occupy pos on the given page in the menu

      • getElementAt

        public static java.util.Optional<IElement> getElementAt(IMenu menu,
                                                        int page,
                                                        org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.property.SlotPos pos)
        Performs the same lookup as getElementsAtPosition, but only returns the first result in case you know that a position does not contain more than one element at any given time.
        Parameters:
        menu - the menu to search for elements
        page - the page to search
        pos - the x and y coordinates to search for elements
        Returns:
        a single element that occupies pos on the given page in the menu, or empty if no element was present

      • closeInventory

        public static void closeInventory(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player player)
        Closing the menu 1 tick later prevents item duping.
        In order to close all other views (like books that normally don't have a close-method) a inventory-open is sent prior to closing the inventory.
        Note: This is not a API method and does not notify, it's to visually close a view on the client.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to close a open view for

      • openInventory

        public static void openInventory(org.spongepowered.api.entity.living.player.Player player,
                                 org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.Inventory inventory)
        Open the menu 1 tick later for consistency.
        Unlike closeInventory this does not open a inventory before closing, because opening a inventory always overlaps. Technically the close should be obsolete.
        Note: This is not a API method and does not notify, it's the effective display of an inventory to the client.
        Parameters:
        player - the player to open a inventory for
        inventory - the inventory to display

      • getSlotByAnyMeans

        public static java.util.Optional<org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.Inventory> getSlotByAnyMeans(org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.Inventory inventory,
                                                                                                   org.spongepowered.api.item.inventory.property.SlotPos pos)
        looks like inventory properties like slot position etc are not always properly passed down to sub inventories, thus I'll make it work... somehow
        Retrieves the slot from a SlotPos in the following order:
        • Query the SlotPos
        • Query the SlotIndex as y*9+x
        • Stream the Slots for the first Slot that contains a correct SlotIndex
        Parameters:
        inventory - the inventory to search the slot in
        pos - the Grid Position to search
        Returns:
        the first Slot with the matching pos upcast as Inventory as returned by the inventory query
